item.title: What is the mayor of the borough of Hackney doing about this chaos situation of ltn HAC01 at Chatsworth Road causing destruction distress,noise,traffic gridlock due to signs being put up but not in forced at time no information to warn vehicles in advance.. Workman putting black bin liners over the LTN no vehicles prohibited signs causing confusion amongst drivers. This rollout scheme has not properly been fought through no advanced warning signs causing traffic to do u-turns gridlock everywhere., 17th August
item.description:
Mayor of Hackney causing destruction to residents, businesses.LTN HAC01 obscured by black bin bag liners which workman from Hackney council covered signs up with. This is amateur behaviour from hackney council. Who puts black bags over no vehicle sign

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Chatsworth Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hazardous overgrown trees and weeds on Carstairs Road, 17th August
item.description:
For well over 4 months the trees and pavements have been overgrown with weeds and bushy trees. Prams and wheelchairs cannot get past without people having to go into the road, which is a health and safety concern. Disabled people..e.g blind, are also being impacted by this. Please please can the weeds in the pavements and the base of the trees be dealt with as a matter of urgency before someone gets blinded or seriously hurt.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Carstairs Road, Southend, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Equipment missing, 17th August
item.description:
The swing has been missing for months this is the summer holidays and a popular park, the kids love the giant rope swing. The equipment needs updating as this hasn't been done for a long time yet this parknis used by the local child and school. I've been to other local parks that have better equipment and have been refurbished more times than this park please use some funds to update instead of using it to update a park that has already had new equipment

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parkside Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large recycling bins have not been emptied for months, 17th August
item.description:
These large recycling bins on both sides of Cornwallis close have not been emptied for months!! They are disgusting, look awful as you drive into the estate, and bring down the overall look of an already rundown, untidy, dirty, estate. It’s embarrassing having people visit!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cornwallis Close, Slade Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kinder Close, London

item.title: Fly tipping, 17th August
item.description:
Someone has been fly tipping onto the top of garage roofs owned and leased by the council on Glenure Road. Rubbish is visible from my flat on Elderslie Road, and will also be from Westmount Road. I have not witnessed who this is, but slowly more and more rubbish has appeared. I would say I first noticed this maybe 4 months ago, but more has appeared over the last 2 weeks. Given the location- on top of a flat roof of garage- this is not being left by accident. As this is visible from my property, it is making the area look unkept and generally dirty.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glenure Road, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet
